str2: Woe!, alas!, uttered in grief or denunciation. A primary exclamation of grief; 'woe'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
From hupokrinomai; an actor under an assumed character, i.e. a dissembler

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
A burial-place, sepulcher, tomb, grave. Masculine from thapto; a grave.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To put into order; I decorate, deck, adorn. From kosmos; to put in proper order, i.e. Decorate; specially, to snuff.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
